activities: Theorem Clinical Research and its U.S. affiliates may receive a number of different types of data from the EU and EEA countries, including employees, potential employees, employees of a third party temporary employment, or consulting agencies, clinical and medical research subjects, clinical and medical investigators and staff conducting medical research, medical and healthcare professionals, consumers, investors and shareholders, customers, suppliers, and government officials.  These data are transferred to the U.S. for electronic storage and use via centralized databases which support the company's regulatory obligations, market research, marketing and sales of its services and products, activities to support and fulfill the company's obligations to employees and retirees, recruitment of new employees, activities related to the company's financial management and tax obligations, activities related to the conduct of business with the company's suppliers, vendors, and contractors of goods and services, and other legal and legitimate business activities.
eucountries: Belgium, Czech Republic, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Netherlands, Poland, Spain, United Kingdom
personaldata: On-Line, Manually-Processed, Human Resources, Customer, Clinical Trial Investigator Experience
recoursemech: Unresolved employee complaints are referred to the local EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs).
